nflreadpy.coverage: Historical seasons, player stats, team stats, schedules, rosters

sportsref_nfl.coverage: Career records, franchise history, Hall of Fame, play-by-play, awards

nflscrapy.coverage: Historical ELO ratings, DVOA, EPA, advanced analytics

nfl_next_gen_stats.coverage: Next Gen Stats (tracking data: separation, cushion, speed, etc.)

manual_curation.coverage: Awards, accolades, historical context, era definitions, curated notes
manual_curation.documentation: Research from NFL.com, Hall of Fame, team sites

injury_games.notes: Injury reports not consistently tracked historically

player_game_logs.note: Game log fields mirror season stats fields but at game granularity. Coverage percentages are similar.
player_game_logs.fields_summary: Fields 96-180 follow the same pattern as season stats (fields 1-95) but at the game level. All traditional stats (passing, rushing, receiving, defensive) are available from nflreadpy and sportsref_nfl for 1970-2024. Next Gen Stats are partial (2016+). Snap counts available from 2012+.

player_career_aggregates.note: Career aggregates are calculated from season stats, with high availability. Missing data only for fields requiring Next Gen Stats or recent tracking innovations.
player_career_aggregates.fields_summary: Fields 181-290 are career-level aggregations. Most fields are calculated from season totals (100% coverage). Playoff stats, Super Bowl stats, and career milestones (Pro Bowls, All-Pro, HOF) available from sportsref_nfl with manual curation for awards.

fields.note: Play-by-play fields (291-365) available primarily from sportsref_nfl starting in 1994. Advanced metrics (EPA, WPA, success rate) available from nflscrapy starting in 1999. Core play data includes situation, play type, outcome, and player involvement. Next Gen Stats metrics (completion probability, expected yards) available 2016+.

team_season_stats.fields_summary: Fields 366-485 cover team-level season statistics. Core team identity (366-372), record (373-386), offense (387-416), defense (417-446), special teams (447-461), and advanced metrics (462-485). Traditional stats available 1970-2024 from nflreadpy. Advanced metrics (DVOA, EPA, ELO) available from nflscrapy for 1999-2024. Home/away/conference/division records available throughout.

leaderboards.fields_summary: Fields 486-530 define leaderboard structures. All leaderboards are calculated from existing player/team stats, so coverage is 100%. Includes passing (501-506), rushing (507-510), receiving (511-515), defensive (516-523), and team leaderboards (524-530). Can be filtered by era, position, active vs retired players.

historical_context.fields_summary: Fields 531-570 provide historical context. Era definitions (531-538), season context (539-548), awards & recognition (549-560), and Hall of Fame (561-570). Most data from sportsref_nfl and manual_curation. Awards data 100% available from official NFL records. Era definitions and season context require manual curation but are well-documented.

advanced_analytics.fields_summary: Fields 571-605 cover advanced analytics. EPA (571-578), DVOA (579-584), Success Rate (585-589), Win Probability (590-593), and Next Gen Stats (594-605). EPA/DVOA/Success Rate available 1999-2024 from nflscrapy. Next Gen Stats (tracking data) available 2016-2024 from nfl_next_gen_stats. This is the section with most partial coverage due to recency of advanced metrics.

situational_splits.fields_summary: Fields 606-805 provide situational performance splits. Home/Away (606-625), By Quarter (626-665), Down & Distance (666-695), Field Position (696-725), Score Differential (726-755), By Opponent Type (756-775), Weather & Surface (776-805). Traditional splits (home/away, quarter, down/distance) available from nflreadpy for most of history. Weather data partial/inconsistent before 2000s. Advanced situational data requires play-by-play (1994+).

awards_accolades.fields_summary: Fields 806-850 track awards and accolades. Individual Season Awards (806-820), Playoff & Super Bowl Awards (821-830), Career Honors (831-845), Team Awards (846-850). Nearly 100% coverage from sportsref_nfl and manual_curation. Official awards (MVP, Pro Bowl, All-Pro, HOF) are well-documented for entire 1970-2024 period. Team-specific awards may require additional curation.

modern_era_2016_2024.notes: Near-complete coverage including all Next Gen Stats

analytics_era_1999_2015.notes: Excellent coverage. Missing only Next Gen Stats (2016+)

pre_analytics_1970_1998.notes: Traditional stats fully available. Missing advanced analytics, detailed tracking

qb.notes: All traditional passing stats 1970+. Advanced metrics 1999+. NGS 2016+

rb.notes: All traditional rushing stats 1970+. Advanced metrics 1999+. NGS 2016+

defensive.notes: Sacks 1982+. Tackles 2001+. Most other stats 1994+. NGS 2016+

traditional_stats.notes: Yards, TDs, completions, attempts - excellent historical coverage

advanced_analytics.notes: EPA, DVOA, WPA, Success Rate - available 1999+ (some 2016+)

next_gen_stats.notes: Perfect coverage for available years, but limited to 2016+

situational_splits.notes: Basic splits widely available, advanced splits require PBP data (1994+)

awards_context.notes: Awards, HOF, era context well-documented across entire period

calculated_fields.notes: Rates, ratios, averages - calculated from base stats

high_confidence: All traditional offensive stats (passing, rushing, receiving) for 1970-2024
Team season records and standings for 1970-2024
Awards (MVP, Pro Bowl, All-Pro, HOF) for 1970-2024
medium_confidence: Defensive stats before 2001 (tackles not consistently tracked)
Advanced analytics before 1999 (EPA, DVOA not calculated)
low_confidence: Injury-specific game absences (injury reports not public until recently)
Team-specific awards (requires manual curation per team)

phase_1_foundation.description: Implement core traditional stats with 100% coverage (1970-2024)
tasks: Ingest player season stats from nflreadpy (passing, rushing, receiving)
Ingest team season stats from nflreadpy (offense, defense, special teams)
Implement data validation and quality checks
Parse play descriptions into structured data
Create aggregation pipelines for player/team stats from PBP
Implement situational filtering (down, distance, field position, score)

phase_3_advanced_analytics.description: Implement advanced analytics (EPA, DVOA, WPA, Success Rate)
tasks: Aggregate advanced metrics to player/team season level
Integrate NFL Next Gen Stats API
Ingest tracking data (separation, cushion, time to throw, etc.)
Map NGS player IDs to internal player IDs
Aggregate NGS metrics to season level
Aggregate season stats to career totals
Track playoff and Super Bowl performance
Implement filtering (all-time, era, position, team, active/retired)
Aggregate stats by weather & surface (where available)

phase_8_awards_context.description: Curate awards, honors, and historical context
tasks: Scrape awards data from sportsref_nfl (MVP, Pro Bowl, All-Pro, HOF)
Document season context (rule changes, expansion, realignment)

data_accuracy_checks: Cross-validate season totals against official NFL records
Cross-validate career totals against Pro Football Reference
Verify playoff and Super Bowl stats against game footage/boxscores
Spot-check random sample of 100 player seasons for accuracy
completeness_checks: Verify all teams have data for all seasons 1970-2024
Verify no missing games in game logs
Check for missing players (compare roster sizes to expected)
Identify and flag data gaps (e.g., missing tackles before 2001)
consistency_checks: Verify season totals = sum of game logs
Verify career totals = sum of season totals
Check calculated fields match manual calculations
Verify team totals = sum of player totals (within reason)
edge_cases: Handle team relocations (e.g., Rams STL ‚Üí LA)
Handle team name changes (e.g., Washington Redskins ‚Üí Commanders)
Handle expanded playoffs (Wild Card introduced, format changes)
Handle players traded mid-season (split stats across teams)

database_indexes: Index on player_id for fast player lookups
Index on season for time-based queries
Index on team_id for team-based queries
Composite index on (player_id, season) for player season lookups
Index on position for position-based filtering
caching_strategy: Cache leaderboards (regenerate weekly during season, monthly off-season)
Cache career aggregates (regenerate after season ends)
aggregation_pipelines: Pre-calculate season totals from game logs
Pre-calculate career totals from season totals

frequency.off_season: After draft, after awards announced, ad-hoc for corrections

processes: Manual awards curation (annual, after awards announced)
Manual HOF updates (annual, after induction ceremony)
